sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Investigates Claims On Behalf of Investors of SCHMID Group N.V. - SHMD
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP is investigating potential claims on behalf of investors of SCHMID Group N.V. (NASDAQ:SHMD) following a significant drop in its stock price. The investigation stems from the company's disclosure on November 17, 2025, that Nasdaq's Listing Qualifications Department had decided to delist its shares due to the failure to file its 2024 annual report. This news led to a 31.51% decline in Schmid's stock over two trading sessions.

feed.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Investigates Claims On Behalf of Investors of SCHMID Group N.V. - SHMD
feed.summary: Pomerantz LLP is investigating claims against SCHMID Group N.V. (NASDAQ: SHMD) following a significant drop in its stock price. feed.title: SCHMID Announces Successful Delivery and Installation of its InfinityLine C+ System to a Leading Japanese Advanced Packaging Customer
feed.summary: The SCHMID Group has successfully delivered and installed its first InfinityLine C+ system to a Japanese customer in the Advanced Packaging market. This system, representing SCHMID's next-generation vertical spin process technology, aims to enhance Panel Level Packaging and high-density glass substrate manufacturing with features like single-panel processing and high uniformity. This milestone strengthens SCHMID’s innovation leadership and expands its footprint in the electronics sector.

feed.title: SCHMID's update on positive developments in the market leading to a positive outlook for 2026, while 2025 and 2024 remain transition years below expectations
feed.summary: SCHMID Group, a global solutions provider, announced a positive outlook for 2026, driven by recovery in its markets, particularly advanced packaging, AI servers, and military & space applications, with projected sales over EUR 100 million. However, 2024 results were below expectations due to trade conflicts, and 2025 sales, while higher than 2024, are still below previous guidance. The company has also restructured over €30 million in financial liabilities and is negotiating a new financing package to support future growth and operations.

feed.title: SCHMID wins Innovation Award productronica 2025 for InfinityLine L+
feed.summary: SCHMID Group's InfinityLine L+ has been awarded the Innovation Award productronica 2025 in the Cluster PCB & EMS category. This recognition highlights SCHMID's novel Chemical Mechanical Planarization (CMP) solution which enables precise processing of large-format substrates and PCBs up to 24.5” × 24.5”, critical for next-generation manufacturing, advanced packaging, and SLP applications. The innovation addresses challenges in processing large, fragile materials, providing a breakthrough in precision and scalability for advanced electronics manufacturing.

feed.title: SCHMID Group N.V. Receives Notice of Delisting or Failure to Satisfy a Continued Listing Rule or Standard
feed.summary: SCHMID Group N.V. received a staff determination letter from Nasdaq on November 12, 2025, notifying the company of its non-compliance with a filing requirement and potential delisting. SCHMID intends to appeal the determination and request a continued stay of suspension. The company is working to file its 2024 Annual Report as soon as practicable.

feed.title: SCHMID Group secures major orders for Panel Level Packaging (PLP) and modified-Semi-Additive (mSAP) production equipment
feed.summary: SCHMID Group announced two significant orders for its Panel Level Packaging and mSAP production equipment, driven by the surge in AI-driven semiconductor demand. These projects involve delivering advanced equipment to customers in Southeast Asia and China for AI Server PCB production, underscoring SCHMID's role in next-generation electronics manufacturing. The demand is fueled by projected growth in semiconductor revenues, expected to reach $1.1 trillion by 2029, and a 24% increase in AI server shipments in 2025.

feed.title: SCHMID Group Expands Advanced Packaging Portfolio to Power the AI Era
feed.summary: SCHMID Group has significantly expanded its Advanced Packaging portfolio, introducing new InfinityLine products and glass core substrate solutions to meet the growing demands of the AI era. This expansion positions SCHMID as a key enabler for next-generation advanced packaging and high-performance AI server boards. The company anticipates above-market growth from 2026 onwards, driven by its AI-focused product lines.
